dataList.desc:
Whirr-clink. Whirr-clink.

Sounds of sticky, oily clockwork echoes.

It is the sound of each cog indents clicking into each other. It is the sound of flowing streams of water conjoining.

A tired, downcast duck stands before you.

The clockwork whirrs vigorously, but the rabbit appears weary.

... No, perhaps this is a duck.

The Rabbit asks.

'What am I, in your eyes?'

'What do you think?'

The shard, suspended in air, asks.

'Those things revolving along the track.'

'They're bound by an unseen force, aren't they?'

The shard is surrounded by two different types of tracks. Some rotate wildly, while some do so gently.

'But I'm not binding them here because I want to.'

'They're stuck to me, you see.'

'What do you think?'

options.message: I pity the ones that are bound.
I pity the one that binds.

dataList.desc:
This place is like a giant scrapyard.

All kinds of refuse find their way here, only to be burned.

The difference is that this scrapyard collects nothing but bones.

Human bones beast bones and the bones of something that is neither human nor beast

All kinds of bones find their way here.

A faint voice can be heard from the pile, but it is too feeble to be understood.

options.message: Search to find where the voice is coming from.

dataList.desc:
Shhhh-chk.

Shhhh-chk.

There is a skeleton, making ominous, labored noises.

There is a shadow of somebody in its spine.

Does the shadow breathe, one must ponder.

options.message: Pick up a respirator and put it in its mouth.

result:
The shadow in the skull was nothing but a lingering feeling.

Spite. Penitence. All is pointless. So it fades away in silence.

All that remains is a hollow skull.

dataList.desc:
There is an entity bound to an extravagantly ornamented chair.

It appears as though the entity is shooting a stern glare this way.

It tries to say something... but its mouth is bound.

The King on the throne twists and thrashes, trying to approach... but the things that bind drags him away.

The beautiful yet cruel crimson strips of fabric. They pull mercilessly. They are...

Sounds of heavy rocks scraping against each other.

What looked like palms are made of black rocks.

At the tip of the fingers attached to the palms are smaller palms and smaller fingers.

It reaches out with the hand of the hand.

The voice speaks.

'Yes. The deep sea is a dark place.'

'But at the end of that dark path is a light.'

'Because there are things that shine in the dark there.'

'Let's go there.'

'And we'll shine brighter than anything in that dark place.'

'We were all abandoned, yes. But we all had dreams, too. Remember?'

'Well, let's make our dreams come true. Let's sink together into the depths.'

The dim fluorescent lights impaling the entity's back flicker.

options.message: Say that you will sink together.
Fix the entity's flickering fluorescent lights.

dataList.desc:
This is a corridor of a large, wooden mansion. Its floorboards are ancient.

You can hear creaking noises approaching from a distance. Something walks in this direction.

'My master had a very unfortunate life.'

'I am the butler of this house.'

'Sad, sad things happened here. Many sad things.'

'I still carry with me my master's portrait because no one remembers them anymore.'

'How is it? Can you see it well?'

options.message: Say that you can't see it well.
Say that you can see it well.

dataList.desc:
There is a massive, winged, marble statue.

Its arms and the head are not made of stone, however.

Instead, a translucent and solid light shimmers there.

The shimmering, mirage-like head is blowing a trumpet. One of its arms wields a blade.

What could this statue be commemorating?

Someone is breathing heavily and angrily.

A large, towering figure is trembling and shaking. Its breathing is labored.

It is unclear whether it was from wrath or sadness.

'You! Who's there?!'

The figure talks to you.

'Look at this. What the hell does it say here?'

The figure, shoving a piece of paper before you, appears to be blind. 

The paper says that the secret about... something... must be kept.

It is a record of a certain patient.

'Tell me. What does the paper say?'

options.message: Tell the figure that it's nothing.

dataList.desc:
The bell tolls.

It creaks a few times...

And tolls again.

The bell tolls to tell the time. It swings all the way back, as though it's about to tip over... then balances itself again.

Every time it balances itself, the sound of a broken bell tolls.

The bell precariously swings back once again.

A lone signpost stands atop a snowy mountain.

A closer inspection revealed that it was, in fact, not a signpost.

Yet it functions as a signpost.

Stiff corpses point to various directions with their frozen arms.

What awaits at the end of the paths these fingers point to?

options.message: North, to where the burst-open arm points.
result:
At the end of the path is an ashen village, burned to the ground.

Most buildings are in ruins, as though this village had once been an epicenter of a great explosion.

The snowstorm carries with it a burnt scent.

A cabin stands out amidst this ashen ruin buried under ash and snow.

options.message: East, to where the warning hand points.
result:
There is a dark cave.

Terrifying shrieks emanate from the cave. A cacophony of horrible screams.

options.message: West, to where the broken hand points.
result:
A flowerbed appears past the snowstorm. It looks rather out of place.

Maybe this can be a place of respite.
We decided to ignore the signpost of hands and walk past it.

You find a boiling pot inside the cabin.

Many must have perished in the cold, having failed to find this cabin.

The cabin is completely buried by an avalanche.

The cabin, which was the only recognizable structure in this village, is completely gone from sight.

There is a compass there that keeps spinning, unable to find a direction.

The screams stop as soon as you pick up the compass.

The lost ones' screams continue to echo.

One may assume that they know the way... but there's no telling directions in this endless field of snow.

After taking a brief respite, you notice that the frost had dwindled somewhat.

The path forward is unclear... but let's keep moving anyway.

The path ahead is an endless blizzard.

A respite like the one you saw earlier will not be easy to find.

dataList.desc:
Welcome. This is the city of peace, Metropolaris.

No one can be hurt here at Metropolaris.

The entity called it a city... but there's nothing here.

The only recognizable being here is the entity that greets you without even looking in your direction.

options.message: Ask if there are any other citizens.
result:
'There are. Somewhere.'

'But you can't meet them.'

'Citizens of this city can never see nor touch each other. That is our revolutionary policy.'

'If no one can touch another...'

The entity adds, a tinge of pride in its words.

'... then no one can hurt another.'

'What are you doing?'

'Reaching out with your hands... to touch is a taboo.'

'If our hands touch, I'll be hurt. You'll be hurt too.'

'And one day... everyone will be hurt.'

'Do as you will.'

'Time does not heal all wounds. It only turns them into scars.'

'You will one day remember us and miss us. You will miss our world where no one can hurt or be hurt by anyone.'

options.message: Stroll this city where there is no one and no one to meet.
result:
The city was infinitely vast, and no one even dares to breathe as we walk.

And its citizens are forever at peace.

options.message: Try to shake its hands anyway.
result:
'NO NO NO NO NO NO!'

'NOTHING CAN HURT ME. DON'T LOOK AT ME. DON'T GIVE ME YOUR HAND. DON'T HURT ME.'

The entity cries as it disappears. It leaves something behind.

options.message: Back off and withdraw your hand.
result:
It didn't even have a hand to shake ours.

You lower your confused, lost hand.
